name: Velocibox
description: Velocibox is a twitch-heavy action game crafted for the hardcore audience.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP Processor: 2 GHz Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: Direct X10.0 Compatible Card DirectX: Version 10 Storage: 90 MB available space Sound Card: Standard Audio

reviews.review_text: Have you ever repeatedly slammed your face into the dirt in hopes of striking gold? Have you ever picked up a spoon and started wacking the asphalt in an attempt to make a tunnel to china?  If you have, this game is for you. This game completely and utterly manages to recreate that feeling of hopelessness and complete frustration we all feel when we desperately try to solve at least one equation on the final math test... Bravo. I can do nothing but reccomend this game most wholeheartedly to everyone who feel they deserve a good whipping. In fact, i hereby vote that instead of penal labor, instead of grounding your kids, instead of invading terrorist countries, we enforce this game on all that has been naughty. Now that's something for santa to consider. Have a miserable experience. (After finally reaching level 2, i died within about 0.0001 seconds and realized i'm back to level one. Good luck!)

When you break down twitch games to their base elements, they tend to revolve around the same basic concepts: fast gameplay, and dodging things at high speeds. Some excel in their simplicity, like the classic flash game Vector Runner or the more recent Super Hexagon, while others add more complexity, such as Pivvot, Wave Wave, and Duet. Point is, that since the core elements are generally similar, it takes something more, something exceptional for games in the genre to stand out. Velocibox is one of those games, and it's perhaps the most addictive twitch game I've played since Super Hexagon.  Expanded and improved from an entry for the current 'Connected Worlds' Ludum Dare, Velocibox is unforgiving. In fact there aren't any checkpoints, when you fail (and you will), you start over from the first stage. Initially, I disliked this lack of checkpoints, but once I played more, I came to appreciate how the game was set up. Success relies on practice, learning the quirks and obstacles of each stage and surmounting them. It's more than twitch reflex but also adaption and gradual improvement, not just 'one more go' but 'I know these obstacles. I can do better'. It's incredibly satisfying to race through stages that had defeated you countless times before.  But what makes Velocibox exceptional, because that's a pretty strong word? Well, it's more that all the game's aspects merge into a excellent whole rather than any individual element. It's the sense of speed, the feeling of racing forward at some extreme velocity, blasting off from stage one without a moment to catch your breath. It's the gravity-defying gameplay, as you flip between floor and ceiling and ride the walls. It's how the gravity flip mechanic opens the door for a wide variety of obstacles that wouldn't be possible in other twitch games, forcing you to deftly maneuver around and across all sides of these corridors. It's the vibrant visuals and effects, the great music, the no-frills presentation that lets you jump into the action in seconds.  I've only reached stage four out of nine, and beating the initial nine stages unlocks an even more insane Super Velocibox mode, so there's a hefty amount of content here. Velocibox is an easy recommendation for fans of the genre.
It's like Super Hexagon but instead, you must collect sh*t to proceed to some more sh*t...

First of all Velocibox as for me is a near-perfect game, at least in its kind, is conceptually simple but challenging, the graphics are minimalist but very well made and with a style guessed, same thing as regards the music and effects, appropriate and that fit perfectly to the game.  Yes, at first might seem a frustrating game, or rather a game with little chance of progressing, but nothing could be more wrong, Velocibox despite the continuous game over gives pure addiction, is one of those games that make you think 'one more turn', finally, so I can safely recommend it.

Title : Velocibox  Gerne  : Action, Indie  Developer  : Shawn Beck   Publisher  : Shawn Beck  Release Date  : 8sept, 2014 'Velocibox is a twitch-heavy action game crafted for the hardcore audience.'   Overall Experience :
BEST HEADACHE SIMULATOR EVER. Never get bored with this game.
Someday, I hope to find out whether there is a level 2.
this game is ♥♥♥♥ing ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t 10/10
Is there a level 3 ? I think I'll never know. edit : OMG there it is !
Very fun and addicting... But also enraging... Still, get the game! It's amurzing!
Really hard. Thats all. Actually omfg hard...

Ok this game is hard to get through. I'm not very good at it either. i only reach level 7 at best (out of 9 i guess). But still i want to play it and get to the end. I know there is nothing there at the end of this game. But it is something special about it. I recall my first attempts to play this game. It was horrible. It was after several hours of unsuccessful attempts and 'wtf am i doing wrong? are you telling me i cant do this?' moments that I reached level 2 and 3. And it was amazing experience. I am so glad that i kept playing it at first. The feeling I've got when I reached those new levels I thought was impossible before was absolutely worth it. I don't regret it at all. And trust me. This game will beat you to death. I like how this game messes with you and your mind. I like how the game keeps throwing stuff at you as you progress. Every new level offers nothing more but death to you. I like how there is no time to think and no room for mistakes. You have to be perfect, go ahead, plan your moves and sh#t. It is not an easy type game there's no practice mode, no easier path or smth, the game offers no helping hand for you (except that init mode which is useless). Every time you fail you'll go from the beginning even though it was only a hair from that damn obstacle or a wrong button you pressed or a millisecond delay of your thought. The game is responsive and fair. It's your fault that you can't play it. It gets very frustrating at times I admit it. But every time you fail there's nothing more to judge but you. It is about challenging yourself, progressing at it and the feeling you get then you're finally good at it.
Awesome game. It's like Super Hexagon but even more... fun!   I barely even made it to the second stage in like 30 tries. xD
Should be called addictabox. Maybe velocicrack.

Played 71 minutes so far, feels more like 20, reached level 3 twice in that time. If you liked Super Hexagon, you will like this (I think I like this a bit more) however the music isn't quite upto scratch so I've got chiptunes on instead.   It's going to be a long night.
What happens when you play a game like this? You cry Why did I buy this? I don't know Do I recommend this game? HELL YES! BEST GAME YOU WILL BOXSIBLE SEE!  Nah I'm kidding. Go buy it! It's cheap :-)
It's brutally hard, even harder than Super Hexagon, but immensely satisfying and enraging at the same time. A must have.

i would have more fun in this game and would totally recommend it to everyone (who likes the genre) only if those things didn't happen:  1- not too rarely when i start my cube is invisible and the whole game messes up 2- a lot of the times collisions mess up. i can end up not hitting a block and at least 30% of the time i don't pick up the cubes even tho i was heading stright towards them. 3- the game window is always on top so i have to either minimize it or move it away. it makes it a pain in the ♥♥♥ to alt tab to other windows as it wont go away.  7/10, needs those things to be fixed ASAP
A game where 5.8% of all players have made more than 1000 attempts and only 0.7% have completed it (according to the achievements) might have a slight imbalance.

Good lord, what a turd. There's nothing here but the most barebone concept of a 'game' and they just left it at that. I cant survive beyond 5 seconds no matter how much I practice. Guess it's my old man syndrome shining through again. There's absolutely nothing else to do here. Even 64KB tech demos back in the day had more GAME to them than this thing. Games like this make me so afraid of spending money on anything unfamiliar on Steam. So glad I didn't.
This game is so hard. Think of a cross between the iOS game, Temple Run, and Super Hexagon.  Have fun wanting to smash your computer!

Do you think Super Hexagon is too easy? Do you like being constantly disoriented? Do you get some sick pleasure from seeing the same game over screen every 2 seconds? Do you hate yourself?  If you answered yes to any or all of the above questions, OH BOY DO I HAVE THE GAME FOR YOU.
Frustrating but addictive. Man, this game is pure evil.
Great game. Maybe a little bit overpriced but I used a coupon to get it so it didn't affect me.
Velocibox is hard, but it nails the fun you want out of this kind of game and there's a rewarding sense of satisfaction to getting further.
Velocibox is a great game! Most people have trouble getting passed the first level, nevermind beating the game, and don't even get me started on super velocibox!
Teaching kids how to count up to 2 since 2015. Maybe in 6 months you learn how to count to 3 or 4
Take Race the Sun and Super Hexagon and you have this Level One simulator.
This game makes me stay up too late at night. Please help.
Great game but the combat and story are lacking. I can't really sympathise with the cube.
flip your box
Great game! any game that makes me rage like hell is obviously doing it's job XD

Simple design, simple gameplay but hard to master.  10 incremental 'normal' levels and additional 10 'super' levels (way harder). Incremental = restart from the beginning when you collide with objects (frustating at times)  And as others have stated: 'This is a whole 'nother realm of twisty-nipple-freshness!' - jackcepticeye
If you wanna rage out in 2-5 minutes then this is for you.
